metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4456 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
ownCloud Desktop Client before 1.8.2 does not callQNetworkReply::ignoreSslErrors with the list of errors to be ignored, whichallows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass the user's certificatedistrust decision and obtain sensitive information by leveraging aself-signed certificate and a connection to a server using its ownself-signed certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libowncloudsync0 - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
nautilus-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-cmd - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-l10n - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: owncloud-client package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
